page.title: 05EVERLEY FARM IN SHROTON
page.content: THE TENANT FARMERS ARE TWO BROTHERS IN PARTNERSHIP WHO HAVE 2 FARM WORKERS AND ONE DAIRYMAN. WHEN IT COMES TO THE SEASON FOR SILAGE MAKING THEY HIRE EXTRA PEOPLE. BEFORE THE WAR 17 PEOPLE WORKED ON THE FARM BUT THEY ONLY HAVE 3 NOW. THEY KEEP A FEW PETS, 2 DOGS, SOME DUCKS AND ABOUT 3 CATS. THE LAND CONSISTS OF 983 ACRES. THERE ARE 180 HECTARES OF WINTER WHEAT, 80 OF WINTER BARLEY, 100 OF SPRING BARLEY 70 OF OIL SEED RAPE, 50 OF DURUM WHEAT AND THE REST IS PASTURE. THEY HAVE 190 DAIRY COWS. THE DAIRYMAN GETS UP AT 3 O'CLOCK AND MILKS THE COWS WHICH TAKES 2 HOURS. HE WORKS ALL MORNING THEN HAS THE AFTERNOON OFF, THEN AT 5 O'CLOCK IN THE EVENING HE MILKS AGAIN. EVERY MORNING THE MILK TANKER COMES TO FETCH THE MILK. ON THE FARM ARE 2 BULLS, THE HEREFORD WILLIAM IS GENTLE BUT AMAZON THE FREISIAN IS FIERCER.
